page.title: 09CUSTOMS (CONT)
page.content: Originally the fair was held on the village green which is now the war memorial. The Great War ended an era in Club Days, except for an August Monday in 1919 which was part of the peace celebrations. The local churches organised a procession which took on a religious theme, and this was the beginnings of the modern form of Club Day. Today, after the procession a wreath is laid at the Cenotaph in the Memorial Gardens, to remind us of the local people killed in the two world wars. On 23rd August 1944 an American aeroplane, travelling during a thunderstorm, crashed onto the Church of England school in Freckleton. Many children and 2 teachers were killed, along with some local residents. This sad event is commemorated every year by prayers and the laying of a wreath on Club Day at the victims' mass grave
